intro: Baccharis huairacajensis, commonly known as the Huairacájense baccharis, is a shrub or small tree native to the Amazon rainforest of Peru. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, often aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in heads, typical of the family. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in secondary growth areas. Due to its ecological importance and unique botanical features, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
